Typically used to refer to a living organism, the concept came from that of

Multiple dynamic equilibrium adjustment and regulation mechanisms make
homeostasis possible.

Homeostasis needs to be distinguished from a simple dynamic equilibriums, which
are not regulated, and steady states, which may be stable but sensitive to
perturbations.
